alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Bullock; Pike; Russell (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 4:57AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Pike, southeastern Bullock, Barbour and Russell Counties through 600 AM CST... At 457 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Ladonia to 7 miles southwest of Brundidge. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Phenix City, Troy, Eufaula, Brundidge, Clio, Hurtsboro, Midway, Clayton, Louisville, Banks, Blue Springs, Tyler Crossroads, Pickett, Richards Crossroads, White Oak, Doster, Gaino, Seale, Comer and Barbour County Public Lake Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for southeastern and east central Alabama.
